Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

English

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin manipulāris: compare French manipulaire.

Adjective

[edit]

manipular (comparative more manipular, superlative most manipular)

  1. of or relating to a maniple (Roman army division)
  2. manipulatory
    manipular operations
  3. manipulative

Derived terms

[edit]
  • micromanipular

Anagrams

[edit]
  • planarium

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Medieval Latin manipulare.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [mə.ni.puˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [ma.ni.puˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

manipular (first-person singular present manipulo, first-person singular preterite manipulí, past participle manipulat)

  1. (transitive) to manipulate, to operate
    Synonym: manejar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of manipular (first conjugation)
infinitive manipular
gerund manipulant
past participle masculine feminine
singular manipulat manipulada
plural manipulats manipulades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès

imperfect manipulava manipulaves manipulava manipulàvem manipulàveu manipulaven
future manipularé manipularàs manipularà manipularem manipulareu manipularan
preterite manipulí manipulares manipulà manipulàrem manipulàreu manipularen
conditional manipularia manipularies manipularia manipularíem manipularíeu manipularien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present manipuli manipulis manipuli manipulem manipuleu manipulin
imperfect manipulés manipulessis manipulés manipuléssim manipuléssiu manipulessin

vós 		vostès
affirmative — manipula manipuli manipulem manipuleu manipulin
negative (no) — no manipulis no manipuli no manipulem no manipuleu no manipulin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • manipulable
  • manipulador

Related terms

[edit]
  • maniple
  • manípul
  • manipulació

Further reading

[edit]
  • “manipular”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “manipular”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “manipular” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “manipular” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Ido

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /manipuˈlar/

Verb

[edit]

manipular (present tense manipulas, past tense manipulis, future tense manipulos, imperative manipulez, conditional manipulus)

  1. (transitive) to manipulate, handle, wield
    Synonym: manuagar

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of manipular
present past future
infinitive manipular manipulir manipulor
tense manipulas manipulis manipulos
conditional manipulus — —
imperative manipulez — —
adjective active participle manipulanta manipulinta manipulonta
adverbial active participle manipulante manipulinte manipulonte
nominal
active participle 		singular manipulanto manipulinto manipulonto
plural manipulanti manipulinti manipulonti
adjective passive participle manipulata manipulita manipulota
adverbial passive participle manipulate manipulite manipulote
nominal
passive participle 		singular manipulato manipulito manipuloto
plural manipulati manipuliti manipuloti

Related terms

[edit]
  • manipulo

Verb

manipular

  1. to manipulate

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French manipuler.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ma.ni.puˈla(ʁ)/ [ma.ni.puˈla(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ma.ni.puˈla(ʁ)/ [ma.ni.puˈla(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /ma.ni.puˈla(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /ma.ni.puˈla(ʁ)/ [ma.ni.puˈla(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ma.ni.puˈla(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /mɐ.ni.puˈlaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /mɐ.ni.puˈlaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /mɐ.ni.puˈla.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: ma‧ni‧pu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

manipular (first-person singular present manipulo, first-person singular preterite manipulei, past participle manipulado)

  1. to manipulate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of manipular (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person

manipulando

Imperfect manipulava manipulavas manipulava manipulávamos manipuláveis manipulavam
Preterite manipulei manipulaste manipulou manipulamos1, manipulámos2 manipulastes manipularam
Pluperfect manipulara manipularas manipulara manipuláramos manipuláreis manipularam
Future manipularei manipularás manipulará manipularemos manipulareis manipularão
Conditional manipularia manipularias manipularia manipularíamos manipularíeis manipulariam
Subjunctive
Present manipule manipules manipule manipulemos manipuleis manipulem

Future manipular manipulares manipular manipularmos manipulardes manipularem
Imperative
Affirmative manipula manipule manipulemos manipulai manipulem
Negative (não) não manipules não manipule não manipulemos não manipuleis não manipulem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • manipulação
  • manipulador
  • manipulável

Related terms

[edit]
  • mão

[edit]

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin manipulus.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /manipuˈlaɾ/ [ma.ni.puˈlaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ma‧ni‧pu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

manipular (first-person singular present manipulo, first-person singular preterite manipulé, past participle manipulado)

  1. to manipulate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of manipular (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive manipular
gerund manipulando
past participle masculine feminine
singular manipulado manipulada
plural manipulados manipuladas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

vos 		usted nosotros

affirmative manipulatú
manipulávos 		manipule manipulemos manipulad manipulen
negative no manipules no manipule no manipulemos no manipuléis no manipulen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
